forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 47. Southwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.shortForecast: Light Rain Likely then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 10am. Mostly cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South wind 2 to 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight settles gently over Downtown San Francisco, the city prepares for the embrace of a cool evening. The forecast hints at rain, creeping in after the witching hour, while temperatures plunge into the chilly realm of the upper forties. The night feels damp with a 60% chance of precipitation, and a soft breeze from the southwest scarcely brushes against one’s skin, inviting a cozy wrap of layers—a light jacket, perhaps, snug enough to keep the sharpness of the cold at bay.

Sunday looms, promising a continuation of this moody tableau. The rain will likely grace us before the sun makes its first appearance, washing the streets in a light, gentle patter. With the high only reaching around 57, and the afternoon dragging the warmth a bit lower, it’s prudent to dress not just for warmth but for comfort amid the dampness. Trendy boots will do well in puddles, as the weather turns from blustery to brisk, wrapping the city in a gauzy veil that softens the outlines of its iconic skyline. One might venture into a café, cozying up with a book, or enjoy a leisurely stroll beneath an umbrella, allowing the rhythm of the rain to accompany the quiet of the day—as its softness transforms the ordinary into a moment of serene indulgence.
